content.description: Rachel and Monica’s, everyone is getting ready to go to a banquet

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right they got water, orange juice, and what looks like cider. (takes a glass from the fridge.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Taste it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep, it’s fat. I drank fat!
content.parenthetical: drinks from the glass and puts it back in the fridge

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know, I did that two minutes ago.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, mister tux!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why aren’t you guys dressed?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We have a half hour.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, four minutes ago you had a half hour, we have to be out the door at twenty to eight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Relax Ross, we’ll be ready. It only takes us two minutes to get dressed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you know, I’d feel a whole lot better if you got dressed now.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Okay. (they don’t move)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey-hey! Oh, look at you, all sexy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooooh! Wow!! Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How come you didn’t come over earlier?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ’Cause, I’m a stupid, stupid man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Ross, want some cider?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. (to Rachel) So, um, let’s see your pretty close, huh. Make-up’s on, hair’s done.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I just have to get dressed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay! And that takes what? Just six or seven minutes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Once, I figure out what I’m wearing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Glass of fat?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s. Ross is acting nervous

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s a matter Ross? What you’re nervous about your speech?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Do you wanna hear it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Am I in it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, huh. Yeah, right after I thank everyone for giving money to the museum, I sing a song about the wonder that is Joey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, hello! You look great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you! I know, though.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You see this, this is a person who is ready to go. Phoebe you, oh, you are my star.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, well, you’re my lucky penny.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I took the quiz, and it turns out, I do put career before men. (to Joey) Get up.
content.parenthetical: entering from bathroom, with an issue of Cosmo

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re in my seat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How is this your seat?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’Cause I was sitting there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But then you left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s not like I went to Spain. I went to the bathroom, you knew I was coming back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the big deal, sit somewhere else.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The big deal is I was sitting there last, so, that’s my seat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, actually the last place you were sitting was in there (points to the bathroom). Soo…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You guys, you know what, you know what, it doesn’t matter, because you both have to go get dressed before the big vain in my head pops. So..

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, Ross, I just have to do one thing, really quickly, it’s not a big deal. (yells at Joey) GET UP!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, Phoebe, you look great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right all ready.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, are you gonna do magic?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s, that’s funny. Change!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hang on a second I just got in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t care it starts at eight, we can’t be late.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We could not, would not want to wait.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, our table is down in front, okay, my boss is gonna be there, everyone will see if we arrive after it starts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Has somebody been drinking my fat? (Joey and Chandler look at each other)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys, (holds up an outfit) does this look like something the girlfriend of a paleontologist would wear?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know, you might be the first one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, did you check the machine?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, no. Wait, you know what, this is the outfit that makes my calves look fat. Nevermind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Joey, I wrote a little song today. It’s called: Get Up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! You can have the chair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my, would you look at that! (holds up crossed fingers)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “Hi, it’s me, I’m coming over now. Hey, what if I’m already there when your playing this message?” (to the guys) Is that too spooky?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: “Hi Rach, are you there? It’s me, pick up. Rachel. Rach!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nevermind.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: “Monica, it’s Richard. Call me.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is-is-is that message old or new? (yelling) Old or new?! Old or new?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s old, it’s definitely old. Didn’t you hear the, the double beep?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if it’s new? I mean, we agreed not to talk again, unless we had something really important to say. Shouldn’t I call him back?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, you did call him back. ’Cause, it’s, it’s really old.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, see Mon, listen, listen. When Carol and I broke up, I went through the same thing. And you know what I did?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I…got…dressed. Really, really quickly. Okay, okay. (Rachel starts to follow Monica into her room, but Ross stops her and sends her back to her room.) There we go, there we go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know what, okay, fine. Don’t get up, you just sit right there. I just hope, you don’t mind, you know, my hand right here. (holds his hand a couple of inches in front of Joey’s face) Op, not touching, can’t get mad! Not touching can’t get mad! Not touching can’t get mad! (Joey flings some dip onto Phoebe’s dress)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah! Oh my God! You r-r-rotten boys!

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Sorry Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What am I gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, don’t, don’t, rub it! Don’t! (clapping) What gets out hummus?! What gets out hummus?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, Monica, you know what gets out hummus.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If it is a new message, what is he calling to say?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, thanks. Yeah, I’ll try that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe he’s calling to say your obsessive and crazy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, should I call him back?

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Noo! (Monica starts to go back into her room and stops) NO!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, fine, you know what, we’ll both sit in the chair. (sits on Joey’s lap) I’m soooo, comfortable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too. In fact, I think I might be a little too comfortable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! (jumps up)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, look, we have nineteen minutes. Okay, Chandler, I want you to go and change! Okay. And then, when you come back, Joey will go change, and he’ll have vacated the chair. Okay. Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Fine! I’m going. But when I get back it’s chair sitting, and I’m the guy who’s…sitting in a chair! (leaves)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is this a little too… (sees Phoebe) Pheebs, what happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hummus. I got the hummus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooooh! Honey, well we’ll find you something. Do you wanna wear my black jacket?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That won’t go with this dress though.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you’re right. Well, we’ll find something. Let’s just get you out of that. Come on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no, no, no, no, not out of that, not out of clothes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, can Phoebe borrow your green dress?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I called him.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Nooo.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes. Well I got his machine and I left a message. But it’s okay, it’s okay, it’s okay, because you know it was like a casual, breezy message. It was breezy! Oh God, what if it wasn’t breezy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, how could it not be breezy, no, ’cause, you’re, you’re in such a breezy place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here, I got it. I’ll will play my message for you guys, and you can tell me if it’s breezy enough.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica, how are you gonna do that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know the code to his answering machine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Mon, I really don’t think this is the… Okay, you’re dialing, you are dialing.
(Chandler enters, and Joey is standing near the chair, they have a show down to see who gets the chair and Joey wins)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: “Hi, this is Richard. Please, leave a message at the tone.”

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: “You have two new messages.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, what a cool job. (in a machine voice) ‘You have two new messages.’ ‘Please, pass the pie.’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: “Hi, it’s Monica. I’m just checking in ’cause I got this message from you and I didn’t know if it was old or new or what. So, I’m just checkin’. So let me know, or don’t, whatever. I’m breezy.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you can’t say you’re breezy, that, that totally negates the breezy.

content.speaker: Woman’s Voice
content.text: Hola, it’s me, yesterday was really fun. Call me about this weekend, okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now she sounded breezy.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s seeing someone. I can’t believe he’s seeing someone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, you don’t know that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, who’s voice was that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe it was his sister’s. You know, maybe it was his daughter’s.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Michelle! Of course, it was Michelle! Did it sound like Michelle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, great. It’s starting to rain, that will make it easy to get a cab.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was Michelle. It was definitely Michelle.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, you go with Monica and try on her green dress. If that doesn’t work, you can wear my gray silk one. Oh, gosh, what am I wearing?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You don’t, you don’t know what your wearing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, hon-ey. I’m just trying to look nice for your big night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, which, which we have to leave for in exactly twelve minutes. All right, come on, I’ll just pick something out for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, you will notice that I am fully dressed. I, in turn, have noticed that you are not. So in the words of A. A. Milne, “Get out of my chair, dillhole!”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (he gets up and takes the cushions with him, as he starts to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You said I had to give you the chair, you didn’t say anything about the cushions.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The cushions are the essence of the chair!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right! I’m taking the essence.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho, it’ll be back. Oh-ho, there’s nobody in the room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I’m sorry, I thought it looked pretty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, that was a Halloween costume, unless you would like me to go to this thing as Little Bo Peep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I didn’t recognize it without that inflatable sheep.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, which, by the way Chandler, I would like back one of these days.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Rach, good, listen isn’t this perfect for me! (she’s wearing another dress on a hanger around her neck)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s perfect! But not for tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, of course not for tonight. Yeah, hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not for tonight. Not for tonight! Wh-what, what, what, are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No honey, we’re sorry, we didn’t mean it. I love you. I love you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We used them as pillows when we went camping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The sheep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what you do on your own time…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where’s my underwear?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Come on, come on, what. You took his underwear?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He took my essence!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, now hold on. Joey, why, why can’t you just wear the underwear you’re wearing now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because, I’m not wearing any underwear now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, then why do you have to wear underwear tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s a rented tux. Okay. I’m not gonna go commando in another man’s fatigues.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, then it looks like somebody is gonna have to give back somebody his cushions.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, you hide my clothes. I’m gonna do the exact opposite to you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you, what are you gonna show me my clothes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, opposite, is opposite! (leaves)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s got nothing!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m ready.
content.parenthetical: entering from Rachel’s room, wearing a huge bow to cover the stain

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: Oh, aaaah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, didn’t have anything that I liked, so, but she had this Christmas ribbon, and I thought, ‘All right, fine I’ll be political.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you supporting?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Duh!! Christmas!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, hey, that’s okay with me. Two down and I have exactly twelve minutes… Wha, my watch stopped. My watch. (shows Chandler) Okay, see, the, the dinosaur tail isn’t going around any more. (grabs Chandler’s watch) What time is it? It’s 7:33, I have seven minutes. I have seven minutes!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Pheebs, quick, what shoes should I wear? The black or the purple?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just, just, just pick one!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, okay, okay, the black. But, oh, do you have black, with the little strappys?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeahh, but, but those really go better with pants. Maybe I should wear pants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, pants, what, what an idea. Or better yet, um, how ‘bout you go without any pants. Look, I don’t know what you’re trying to do to me, but just get your butt in there and pick out any shoes that fit your feet, okay. No, no I don’t care if they match. I don’t care if they make your ankles or your knees or your earlobes look fat. Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no just do it. Go in there and pick something out so we can go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I gotta call Michelle. I gotta see if that was her voice or not. I’m sorry, I just have to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was, it was her voice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, I think you’ve gone over to the bad place.

content.speaker: Michelle
content.text: Hola! Hello. Hello?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. That was her right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Definitely.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See there you go. Woo! We’re out of the woods. Okay, I’ll get dressed now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay!
(phone rings)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ll get it, okay. (answers phone) Hi, Monica and Rachel’s. (listens) Yeah, just a second, can I ask who’s calling. (to Monica) Oh, ew, it’s Michelle! Ew! She, she must have that Caller Id thing. You should get that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, Michelle. Yeah, that was me, I-I dialed your number by mistake. (listens) Oh, you’re so sweet. Yeah, we were a great couple. I know I really miss him. Well, you know how it is, it’s that…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know what’s weird. Donald Duck never wore pants. But whenever he’s getting out of the shower, he always put a towel around his waist. I mean, what is that about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Michelle, I only beeped in so I could hear my message. I mean that’s allowed. Yeah-huh! I mean look, yeah, you know what I would really appreciate it if you didn’t tell your Dad about. What do you mean, you’re not comfortable with this? Come on we’re friends!! (Michelle hangs up) That bitch always hated me. I’m calling her back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no, no. Tick, tick, tick, tick.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, fine. (runs to her room)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They got a phone in there, right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, we’re on it. We’re on it.
(Rachel comes out from her room wearing sweat pants and a sweatshirt)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um. I know it says black tie optional, but, um this may be pushing it a little, um.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not gonna gooo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not going to go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I think I’m gonna catch up on my correspondence.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How, how, um how can you not be going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not gonna gooo, so I think that will accomplish the not going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, you know, just out of curiosity…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, ever since I was humiliated and yelled at in front of my friends, I’m just, I don’t know, not in a museum benefitty kind of mood.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. Right, okay, okay. I’m sorry. I’m sorry I yelled.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but, your-your mad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not mad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just not going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your not going.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. You know that I-I have to go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, hum.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. So is it gonna be like ‘I’m abandoning you while your upset.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, because your not upset.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: About the yelling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right, and the humiliating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, well of course, the humiliating. So, so wee, we’re okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, hum.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Honey?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, Ross. (turns toward him)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I love you. (goes to kiss her and she turns away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Get away from that! No! (she comes into the living room carrying the phone) She’s just getting dressed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is it wrong that I was totally aroused by that?
(Joey enters wearing a lot of clothes)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I’m wearing everything you own.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! That is so not the opposite of taking somebody’s underwear!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at me! I’m Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes? Maybe if I wasn’t going commando…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooo-ooh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Whew, it’s hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I don’t know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. Enough, enough with the lunging. No! I’m sick of this. Okay. I’ve had it up to here with you two! Neither you can come to the party!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jeez, what a baby.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, Ross, way to ruin it. I was just going to get dressed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what I don’t care. The only person I cared about getting dressed, is the one person that says she’s not even gonna go. Look Rach, I’m sorry. Okay. Look, I-I wa, I was a jerk. I’m sorry I yelled. I want you there, I need you there. Look, what, what can I do that can show you how much, how much I want you to be there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You could drink the fat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, welcome, to an adult conversation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, now wait, wa, wa, waa-it a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. That actually, uh, that sounds interesting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think you should drink the fat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yaaaay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. If that is what it takes to show you how much you mean to me, and how much I want you there. Then that’s what I’ll do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, wait, let me get you another glass. That’s been sitting out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think this will be fine. Okay, vanilla milkshake, just a vanilla milkshake, with chicken bits floating in it. Cheers. (starts to drink, but Rachel stops him just before he starts drinking)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, wait! Okay, okay. Don’t! I’ll go, I’ll go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You will?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You were really gonna do that, weren’t you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You were gonna drink the fat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s see what else he’ll do!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How ‘bout instead you, go get changed! (to Chandler) You, give him back his underwear! I’m gonna go get a cab, and I want everyone down stairs in two minutes! Monica!
(Joey and Chandler start to leave, Joey is lunging as he is walking)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop it. Stop it!
(Monica runs into the living room, and starts dialing the phone)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, went to get a cab so we can all… No, wh-what are you doing! No, Monica, no!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hi, this is Richard.

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: You have three new messages.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not any more!

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Message erased. To record a message begin speaking at the tone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, uh, Richard it’s Monica, um, listen I did something kind of crazy tonight, um, maybe I’m getting my period or something, I don’t know. Um, anyway, I, I, I beeped into your machine and I heard a message that, that freaked me out, and um, you know what Michelle will tell you the rest. I, I, um, I’m sorry, okay, I, I hope that we can forget the whole thing. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Your outgoing message has now been changed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Outgoing! Did that say outgoing?! Not, outgoing!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: “Hi, uh, Richard it’s Monica, um, listen I did something kind of crazy tonight, um, maybe I’m getting my period or something, I don’t know.” Nooo!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How did you do that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know!

content.speaker: Machine
content.text: Good-bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noooo!!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, okay, I’ve got two cabs and no people. Go! Go! Go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe we could call the phone company. Maybe they could change the message. Maybe they can change his number.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, after this, I think he’ll be doing that himself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel!! (she enters) Wow! You, uh, you look, wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I still have about five seconds to spare. (kisses him) Okay, that was about seven seconds.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So we’re a little late.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on. (they start to leave) Oh! And, uh, by the way…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m going commando, too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Awwww!!!

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: Dr. Geller, Sherman Whitfield, London Institute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! What a pleasure.

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: Well, I have to tell you, I was quite impressed with your paper on Pre-Cretaceous fossils. Yeah, it confirmed everything that I have written.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me. Hi.

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you’re kind of sitting in my seat.

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: What do you mean, your seat?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I mean, I was sitting there.

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: But, you got up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But, I never left the room!

content.speaker: Whitfield
content.text: But, you left the chair area.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, that’s it, give me your underwear.
